id.description: URI when dereferenced, results in a document containing machine-readable information about the issuer that can be used to verify the information expressed in the credential. More information in https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#issuer

@context.description: List of URI to determine the terminology used in the verifiable credential as explained by https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#contexts

id.description: URI to the subject of the credential as explained by https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#credential-subject

type.description: Specific verifiable credential type as explained by https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#types

reference.description: Internal reference, usually a serial number, of this document

name.description: Human readable name of this credential

issuanceDate.description: The date and time when this credential becomes valid (may be deprecated in favor of issued/validFrom a future version of W3C's VC Data Model)

expirationDate.description: The date and time when this credential expires

issued.description: The date and time when this credential becomes valid

validFrom.description: The date and time when this credential becomes valid

validUntil.description: The date and time when this credential expires

type.description: Express the credential status type (also referred to as the credential status method). It is expected that the value will provide enough information to determine the current status of the credential. For example, the object could contain a link to an external document noting whether or not the credential is suspended or revoked.

name.description: Template name to be use by template renderer to determine the template to use

url.description: URL of a decentralised renderer to render this document

type.description: Proof method name as explained by https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#types

location.description: URL of the website referencing to document store OR a valid DID as defined by W3C in https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/

fileName.description: Name of this attachment, with appropriate extensions

mimeType.description: Media type (or MIME type) of this attachment
